intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to configure StatET to connect to and launch an R console from within Eclipse.

item.title: Specify Connector
item.description:
Go to Window > Preferences... > StatET > Run/Debug > R Interaction and choose the R interaction mode of your choice:
New Console inside Eclipse allows to run a Console inside Eclipse,
R-GUI (Windows) allows interaction with the traditional R Gui on Windows and
Classic Console inside Eclipse allows to run an ancient version of the Console inside Eclipse.

item.title: Add R Environment
item.description:
Select the R Environments preference page.
Click on the Add... button to specify the path to the R version you would like to use.
Indicate a name you would like to give to the configuration and specify the directory to which the chosen version of R was installed.

item.title: R Console Launch Configuration
item.description:
Go to Run > Open Run Dialog... and double-click on R Console to create a new configuration.
Specify a Name and edit all tabs of the new launch configuration.

subitem.label: Add suitable Options in the Main tab if desired, such as --no-save, --no-restore or --silent, to be used when invoking R.
Specify the R Environment to be used in the R Config tab. This can be the default R Environment or any other R Environment that has been defined.
Optionally check the box in the Common tab to list this R Launch configuration in the Favorites menu
Click on Apply to save the R Launch Configuration

item.title: Launch the R console
item.description:
Click on Run in the Run Dialog for the R Launch configuration you created.
The R Console will be launched and ready for use from within Eclipse.
